meanings.definition: To remove from its original context.
meanings.sent1: She tried to decontextualize the quote to understand its true meaning.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to decontextualize historical events when studying them.
meanings.sent3: The detective decontextualized the evidence to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The artist decontextualized everyday objects to create a thought-provoking sculpture.
meanings.sent5: By decontextualizing the data, the scientist was able to see patterns that were previously hidden.

meanings.definition: To separate from the circumstances in which it originally occurred.
meanings.sent1: The journalist had to decontextualize the interview to focus on the main points.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to decontextualize emotions from past experiences.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decontextualized a famous movie scene to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The author decontextualized a common saying to give it a new twist in the story.
meanings.sent5: In order to analyze the situation objectively, it is necessary to decontextualize personal biases.
